channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: How New Zealand can avoid lockdowns in the future
item.description: Epidemiologist Sir David Skegg has highlighted the ways in which New Zealand can improve its pandemic response and avoid going into lockdown every time there is a Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Emirates Team NZ: America's Cup will continue under Covid-19 alert levels 3, 4
item.description: Emirates Team NZ says preparations for the 36th America's Cup can and will continue under the Covid-19 alert levels 3 or 4, although that's not what the Auckland mayor's office has said.

item.title: Seven new cases of Covid-19 in the community today
item.description: Seven new cases of Covid-19 have been reported in the community in New Zealand today, with all but one already linked to the cluster responsible for all the previous community cases. Watch live here.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates on Saturday 15 August
item.description: Police in Auckland have not made any arrests for breaches of the Covid alert level 3 restrictions, three full days after they came into force. Follow all the latest updates with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Tokoroa Covid-19 cases spark unease in vulnerable rural areas
item.description: A rural health lecturer is concerned by the appearance of Covid-19 in a rural community, given what he says is their vulnerability to the virus.

item.title: People who test positive should be 'commended' - health boss
item.description: The Director General of Health has slammed online abuse of New Zealanders who contract Covid-19, reiterating his comment that there was "no shame or blame" in having contracted the virus.

item.title: Covid-19: Cook Island community seeks guidance from New Zealand Government
item.description: A community leader in the Cook Islands says they need more guidance from the New Zealand government on what to do in case of a Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Online sales rise as buyers chase Lotto's record prize
item.description: Lotto has seen a large surge in online ticket sales since the alert level 4 lockdown in March.

item.title: 'A culture of leaking': Inquiry fails to find NZTA culprit
item.description: An official inquiry has failed to track down a leaker of light rail documents, after it ran into the sieve-like culture at the NZ Transport Agency.

item.title: Covid-19: Traveller who tested positive overseas visited Rotorua, Taup≈ç
item.description: Two cases of international travellers who tested positive for Covid-19 upon arrival overseas recently are being investigated by the Ministry of Health.

item.title: Massive increase in blocked pipes in Gisborne's sewers after alert level changes
item.description: Since Wednesday, there has been a 600 percent increase in blocked pipes across the local system and residents are being reminded the system can only handle the 'three Ps'.

item.title: NZ extends alert levels: What you need to know
item.description: Auckland's lockdown will probably continue until at least 26 August, the wage subsidy will be extended and an election date may emerge over the weekend.

item.title: Four testing centres in eastern Bay of Plenty
item.description: Eastern Bay of Plenty residents experiencing Covid-19 symptoms are urged call Healthline or visit one of four testing sites this weekend.

item.title: One dead after car crashes into parked truck in Hamilton
item.description: Hamilton police are investigating after a passenger in a car was killed when it crashed into a parked truck overnight.

item.title: Another Covid-19 testing centre to open - in Auckland's Rosedale
item.description: A new pop-up Covid 19 community testing centre is opening in Auckland's North Shore today.

item.title: Two out of 10 recreational drone users have no idea of rules: CAA
item.description: Research has found there are almost 300,000 recreational and commercial drone users in New Zealand - and two out of every 10 recreational drone users have little or no idea about the rules.

item.title: Auckland lockdown to continue for 12 more days
item.description: Auckland will remain in alert level three for a full two weeks, with the government announcing that the country will remain at current Covid-19 alert levels for 12 more days.

item.title: Man accused of murdering Constable Matthew Hunt loses name suppression
item.description: The man accused of murdering Constable Matthew Hunt can be named for the first time, although no photos of the accused can be published.
